title: Matthew Chapter 22 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 22 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 22 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 22.

questions.question: What did the king prepare for his son's marriage according to the parable?
options: A feast with oxen and fatlings
A banquet with bread and wine
A simple meal with fish
A garden party with fruits
questions.correctAnswer: A feast with oxen and fatlings
questions.explanation: The king said, 'Behold, I have prepared my dinner: my oxen and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready' (Matthew 22:4).

questions.question: What was the response of the people originally invited to the wedding?
options: They made light of it and went away
They eagerly accepted the invitation
They asked for more time to prepare
They sent gifts instead
questions.correctAnswer: They made light of it and went away
questions.explanation: The invited guests 'made light of it, and went their ways, one to his farm, another to his merchandise' (Matthew 22:5).

questions.question: What did the king do when his servants were mistreated and killed?
options: Sent his armies and destroyed the murderers
Forgave the murderers
Ignored the situation
Sent more servants quietly
questions.correctAnswer: Sent his armies and destroyed the murderers
questions.explanation: When the king heard about the murder of his servants, 'he sent forth his armies, and destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city' (Matthew 22:7).

questions.question: Who did the king instruct his servants to invite after the original guests were found unworthy?
options: Everyone they found on the highways
Only the rich and powerful
Family members of the original guests
Religious leaders only
questions.correctAnswer: Everyone they found on the highways
questions.explanation: The king said, 'Go ye therefore into the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage' (Matthew 22:9).

questions.question: What was wrong with the man the king found at the wedding feast?
options: He was not wearing a wedding garment
He arrived late
He brought no gift
He was not invited
questions.correctAnswer: He was not wearing a wedding garment
questions.explanation: The king saw 'a man which had not on a wedding garment' (Matthew 22:11).

questions.question: What happened to the man without a wedding garment?
options: He was bound and cast into outer darkness
He was asked to leave quietly
He was given a garment to wear
He was forgiven and welcomed
questions.correctAnswer: He was bound and cast into outer darkness
questions.explanation: The king said, 'Bind him hand and foot, and take him away, and cast him into outer darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth' (Matthew 22:13).

questions.question: Who came to Jesus with the question about paying tribute to Caesar?
options: Pharisees and Herodians
Sadducees only
Disciples alone
The Roman soldiers
questions.correctAnswer: Pharisees and Herodians
questions.explanation: The Pharisees sent their disciples with the Herodians to ask Jesus about paying tribute to Caesar (Matthew 22:16).

questions.question: What did Jesus say about giving tribute to Caesar?
options: Render unto Caesar the things which are Caesar's, and unto God the things that are God's
Do not pay tribute to Caesar
Pay tribute only if you want to
Caesar owns nothing
questions.correctAnswer: Render unto Caesar the things which are Caesar's, and unto God the things that are God's
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar's; and unto God the things that are God's' (Matthew 22:21).

questions.question: What did the Sadducees deny that they questioned Jesus about?
options: The resurrection
The law of Moses
The power of God
The authority of the Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: The resurrection
questions.explanation: The Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, questioned Jesus (Matthew 22:23).

questions.question: According to Jesus, in the resurrection, people will be like whom?
options: The angels of God in heaven
The kings of the earth
The prophets of old
The disciples of Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The angels of God in heaven
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are as the angels of God in heaven' (Matthew 22:30).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that God is the God of the dead, not the living.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'God is not the God of the dead, but of the living' (Matthew 22:32).

questions.question: True or False: The Pharisees were astonished at Jesus' doctrine after He silenced the Sadducees.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The multitude was astonished at Jesus' doctrine after He answered the Sadducees (Matthew 22:33).

questions.question: True or False: The Pharisees asked Jesus which is the greatest commandment in the law.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: A lawyer among the Pharisees asked Jesus about the greatest commandment in the law (Matthew 22:35-36).

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy ______.'
options: mind
strength
might
understanding
questions.correctAnswer: mind
questions.explanation: Jesus said to love God with all your heart, soul, and mind (Matthew 22:37).

questions.question: According to Jesus, on which two commandments hang all the law and the prophets?
options: Love God and love thy neighbour
Keep the Sabbath and honor parents
Do not steal and do not kill
Honor the temple and fast regularly
questions.correctAnswer: Love God and love thy neighbour
questions.explanation: Jesus said all the law and prophets hang on loving God and loving thy neighbour (Matthew 22:40).

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 22 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 22 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with feeling unworthy to be part of God's kingdom. Based on the parable of the wedding feast, what biblical truth would you share about being prepared to enter God's kingdom?
options: One must wear the wedding garment to be accepted in the kingdom
All are automatically accepted without preparation
Only those invited first can enter
The king accepts anyone regardless of readiness
questions.correctAnswer: One must wear the wedding garment to be accepted in the kingdom
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:11-14 shows the king noticing a man without a wedding garment and casting him out, teaching that being properly prepared and clothed signifies readiness and worthiness to enter God's kingdom.

questions.question: How does the parable of the king's invitation to the wedding feast teach us about evangelism and sharing the Gospel?
options: We should invite both good and bad people to hear the Gospel
Only the righteous should be invited
Evangelism is optional
We must wait for others to come to us
questions.correctAnswer: We should invite both good and bad people to hear the Gospel
questions.explanation: Verses Matthew 22:9-10 show the servants gathering all found in the highways, both bad and good, to fill the wedding, illustrating that evangelism is for all kinds of people.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged by rejection while sharing their faith. What lesson about perseverance can be drawn from the king’s reaction to those who rejected his servants?
options: The king sent his armies after the murderers and destroyed their city
The king ignored their rejection and gave up
The king only invited the first guests again
The king accepted rejection silently
questions.correctAnswer: The king sent his armies after the murderers and destroyed their city
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:6-7 describes the rejection and killing of the servants and the king’s decisive response, teaching the seriousness of rejecting God’s message and encouraging believers to persist in faithfulness.

questions.question: What biblical principle about honesty and integrity in daily life is taught through Jesus’ response to the question about paying taxes to Caesar?
options: Render unto Caesar what is Caesar's, and unto God what is God's
Avoid paying taxes at all costs
Only pay taxes if forced
Ignore earthly authorities
questions.correctAnswer: Render unto Caesar what is Caesar's, and unto God what is God's
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:19-21 shows Jesus teaching the importance of fulfilling civic duties honestly while maintaining devotion to God, balancing integrity in earthly responsibilities and spiritual commitment.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ teaching about resurrection in response to the Sadducees encourage believers to trust in God's power over life and death?
options: In the resurrection, people are like angels and God is the God of the living
There is no resurrection
Resurrection is only symbolic
Only some will be resurrected
questions.correctAnswer: In the resurrection, people are like angels and God is the God of the living
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:29-32 explains resurrection realities and God's living relationship with the patriarchs, encouraging trust in God's power beyond death and error in denying resurrection.

questions.question: When tempted by the Pharisees and Herodians about paying taxes, how does Jesus demonstrate wisdom in handling trials and temptation?
options: He perceives their wickedness and answers wisely without falling into their trap
He refuses to answer
He agrees with them
He changes the subject
questions.correctAnswer: He perceives their wickedness and answers wisely without falling into their trap
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:18-21 shows Jesus recognizing the hypocrisy behind the question and giving a wise answer, teaching believers to discern and respond wisely under temptation and trials.

questions.question: A believer asks, 'What is the greatest commandment?' Based on Matthew 22, what is the biblical answer emphasizing spiritual discipline and devotion?
options: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, soul, and mind
Keep all the ceremonial laws
Give offerings regularly
Attend all synagogue meetings
questions.correctAnswer: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, soul, and mind
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:36-38 records Jesus' answer emphasizing loving God fully as the greatest commandment, highlighting the foundation for prayer, devotion, and spiritual discipline.

questions.question: How does Matthew 22 teach the importance of loving others in practical Christian living?
options: Love your neighbor as yourself as the second great commandment
Ignore neighbors’ needs
Love only those who love you
Judge neighbors strictly
questions.correctAnswer: Love your neighbor as yourself as the second great commandment
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:39 highlights loving neighbors as oneself, teaching practical love, forgiveness, and reconciliation essential to Christian life and relationships.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ question to the Pharisees about the Christ being David's son teach us about humility and recognizing God’s greater plan?
options: David calls the Christ ‘Lord,’ showing a deeper divine identity
The Christ is just a political leader
The Christ has no special status
David was mistaken about the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: David calls the Christ ‘Lord,’ showing a deeper divine identity
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:41-45 shows Jesus challenging common understanding, teaching humility and deeper recognition of God's plan and Christ's divine nature.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 22, in the resurrection people will continue to marry as they do on earth.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:30 teaches that in the resurrection people neither marry nor are given in marriage but are like angels, indicating a transformed state beyond earthly marriage.

questions.question: True or False: Matthew 22 teaches that many are called but only a few are chosen for God’s kingdom.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:14 explicitly states 'Many are called, but few are chosen,' emphasizing the necessity of genuine response and obedience in Christian life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus instructs us to love the Lord our God with all our ______, soul, and mind.
options: heart
strength
faith
works
questions.correctAnswer: heart
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:37 teaches the greatest commandment to love God with all our heart, soul, and mind, highlighting wholehearted devotion.

questions.question: How does Matthew 22 instruct believers about humility and readiness in fellowship through the wedding garment parable?
options: One must wear the wedding garment to be accepted
Appearance does not matter
Guests can enter without preparation
Only those invited first may attend
questions.correctAnswer: One must wear the wedding garment to be accepted
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:11-13 shows the man without a wedding garment being cast out, teaching the importance of humility, readiness, and proper conduct in fellowship.

questions.question: According to Matthew 22, what should be our attitude toward civil responsibilities like paying taxes?
options: Render unto Caesar what is Caesar's and unto God what is God's
Avoid paying taxes whenever possible
Only pay if it benefits you
Ignore civil laws completely
questions.correctAnswer: Render unto Caesar what is Caesar's and unto God what is God's
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:21 teaches believers to fulfill their civil duties honestly while maintaining ultimate devotion to God, balancing integrity and obedience.

questions.question: What practical lesson about dealing with temptation and trials can be learned from Jesus’ encounter with the Pharisees and Sadducees in Matthew 22?
options: Discern the intent behind questions and respond with wisdom
Avoid all questions
Agree with every challenge
Ignore trials completely
questions.correctAnswer: Discern the intent behind questions and respond with wisdom
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:15-18 shows Jesus perceiving wickedness and answering wisely, teaching us to be discerning and wise when facing temptation and trials.

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 22 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 22.

questions.question: In the parable of the wedding feast, what action did the king take when the invited guests refused to come and mistreated his servants?
options: He sent more servants and then destroyed the murderers and burned their city
He canceled the wedding feast
He invited only the wealthy guests
He gave the feast to his servants
questions.correctAnswer: He sent more servants and then destroyed the murderers and burned their city
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:6-7 recounts that the guests mistreated and killed the king's servants, so the king sent armies to destroy those murderers and burned their city.

questions.question: What is the significance of the wedding garment in the parable, considering ancient Jewish wedding customs?
options: It symbolizes righteousness required to enter the kingdom of heaven
It represents wealth and social status
It is a sign of the king's favor
It denotes the guest's family lineage
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes righteousness required to enter the kingdom of heaven
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:11-13 describes a man without a wedding garment being cast out, symbolizing the necessity of proper spiritual preparation or righteousness to partake in God's kingdom.

questions.question: How does Jesus' response to the question about paying tribute to Caesar demonstrate His understanding of Roman authority and divine sovereignty?
options: He acknowledges Caesar's authority but prioritizes God's ultimate sovereignty
He refuses to answer to avoid conflict
He encourages rebellion against Rome
He declares Caesar as God
questions.correctAnswer: He acknowledges Caesar's authority but prioritizes God's ultimate sovereignty
questions.explanation: In Matthew 22:21, Jesus teaches to 'Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar's; and unto God the things that are God's,' showing a distinction between earthly and divine authority.

questions.question: The Sadducees' question about the woman who married seven brothers is intended to challenge which doctrine?
options: The resurrection of the dead
The law of Moses
The coming of the Messiah
The existence of angels
questions.correctAnswer: The resurrection of the dead
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:23 indicates that the Sadducees, who deny resurrection, asked Jesus about the woman married to seven brothers as a test of the resurrection doctrine.

questions.question: According to Jesus, what is the nature of marriage in the resurrection as compared to earthly life?
options: People neither marry nor are given in marriage but are like angels
People will have multiple spouses
Marriage will be eternal and unchanged
Marriage will be abolished entirely
questions.correctAnswer: People neither marry nor are given in marriage but are like angels
questions.explanation: In Matthew 22:30, Jesus explains that in the resurrection, people do not marry but are like the angels in heaven, indicating a transformed existence.

questions.question: How does Jesus use the declaration 'I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob' to argue for the resurrection?
options: He shows God is the God of the living, not the dead
He emphasizes the patriarchs' laws
He asserts God’s favoritism to Israel
He refers to the creation story
questions.correctAnswer: He shows God is the God of the living, not the dead
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:32 reveals Jesus' argument that God identifies Himself as the God of the living patriarchs, implying they are alive in resurrection.

questions.question: What is the 'great commandment' that Jesus identifies as the first and greatest in the law?
options: Love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, soul, and mind
Keep the Sabbath holy
Honor thy father and mother
Do not kill
questions.correctAnswer: Love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, soul, and mind
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:37-38 records Jesus stating the greatest commandment is loving God fully with heart, soul, and mind.

questions.question: Which commandment does Jesus say is like the first, and how does this relate to the broader biblical ethic?
options: Love thy neighbour as thyself, emphasizing relational ethics
Do not steal, emphasizing justice
Keep the Sabbath, emphasizing worship
Honor thy parents, emphasizing family
questions.correctAnswer: Love thy neighbour as thyself, emphasizing relational ethics
questions.explanation: In Matthew 22:39, Jesus connects loving one's neighbor with loving God, reflecting the holistic ethic of the law.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the phrase 'For many are called, but few are chosen' in the context of the parable of the wedding feast?
options: Not everyone who is invited will be accepted into God's kingdom
Only the wealthy will inherit the kingdom
Everyone invited will inevitably enter the feast
The invitation is limited to Israel alone
questions.correctAnswer: Not everyone who is invited will be accepted into God's kingdom
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:14 concludes the parable indicating that though many hear the call (are invited), only a few respond rightly and are chosen.

questions.question: How do the Pharisees' attempts to trap Jesus in conversation illustrate the socio-political tensions of first-century Judea?
options: They sought to undermine Jesus' authority amid Roman occupation and Jewish expectation of the Messiah
They were genuinely curious about theology
They wanted to promote Jesus to Herod
They aimed to fund Jesus’ ministry
questions.correctAnswer: They sought to undermine Jesus' authority amid Roman occupation and Jewish expectation of the Messiah
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:15-18 shows Pharisees trying to entangle Jesus by politically charged questions, reflecting tensions under Roman rule and Messianic hopes.

questions.question: What literary device is employed in the parable of the wedding feast to contrast the initial invited guests and those later invited from the highways?
options: Parallelism illustrating inclusion of Gentiles and outcasts
Chiasm emphasizing reversal of fortunes
Metaphor for agricultural cycles
Allegory for temple rituals
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism illustrating inclusion of Gentiles and outcasts
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:9-10 shows servants gathering guests from highways, symbolizing God's kingdom extending beyond Israel, a parallelism contrasting initial rejection and subsequent inclusion.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus’ question about Christ being 'the Son of David' in light of Psalm 110:1?
options: It highlights the paradox of the Messiah's human lineage and divine lordship
It denies David’s messianic prophecy
It asserts that the Messiah is not related to David
It emphasizes Jesus' political ambitions
questions.correctAnswer: It highlights the paradox of the Messiah's human lineage and divine lordship
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:42-45 references Psalm 110:1 to show the Messiah is David’s son yet also David’s Lord, pointing to his dual nature.

questions.question: What rhetorical strategy does Jesus use to silence the Pharisees after asking about the Messiah’s sonship?
options: He poses a paradoxical question that they cannot answer
He performs a miracle
He changes the subject
He appeals to Roman law
questions.correctAnswer: He poses a paradoxical question that they cannot answer
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:45-46 shows Jesus’ question about David calling the Messiah 'Lord' leaves the Pharisees unable to respond, silencing their challenges.

questions.question: True or False: The Pharisees and Sadducees united in their attempt to challenge Jesus with doctrinal questions.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:15-23 shows Pharisees and Sadducees separately questioning Jesus, reflecting their differing beliefs and occasional opposition rather than unity.

questions.question: What is the implied typology of the king in the parable of the wedding feast in relation to God the Father?
options: The king represents God inviting humanity to His kingdom
The king symbolizes an earthly monarch
The king is a representation of the Messiah only
The king depicts a Roman governor
questions.correctAnswer: The king represents God inviting humanity to His kingdom
questions.explanation: Matthew 22:1-2 portrays the king as one who arranges a wedding feast for his son, symbolizing God inviting people to the kingdom of heaven.

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 22 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 22 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What is the primary illustration Jesus uses in Matthew 22 to describe the kingdom of heaven?
options: A king who made a marriage for his son
A shepherd searching for lost sheep
A sower scattering seeds
A vine and its branches
questions.correctAnswer: A king who made a marriage for his son
questions.explanation: Jesus begins Matthew 22 with a parable about a king who prepares a marriage for his son (Matthew 22:2). This imagery illustrates the kingdom of heaven and is consistent with Old Testament imagery of God as a bridegroom (Isaiah 62:5; Hosea 2:19) and the New Testament depiction of Christ as bridegroom (Revelation 19:7).

questions.question: How did the invited guests initially respond to the king's invitation to the wedding feast?
options: They refused to come and made light of it
They rejoiced and came immediately
They asked for more time to prepare
They sent gifts but did not attend
questions.correctAnswer: They refused to come and made light of it
questions.explanation: The invited guests refused to come and made light of the invitation, with some going to their farms and others to their merchandise (Matthew 22:3-5). This reflects human rejection of God's call, consistent with Isaiah 55:1-3 and Luke 14:16-24.

questions.question: What was the king's reaction when his servants were mistreated and some even killed by those bidden to the wedding?
options: He sent armies to destroy the murderers and burn their city
He forgave them and sent more servants
He canceled the wedding feast
He sent a message of warning but took no action
questions.correctAnswer: He sent armies to destroy the murderers and burn their city
questions.explanation: The king became angry and sent armies to destroy those who killed his servants and burned their city (Matthew 22:7). This signifies God's judgment on those who reject His messengers, consistent with Old Testament prophetic warnings (Jeremiah 25:15-29; Ezekiel 21:31).

questions.question: After the original guests were found unworthy, who did the king command his servants to invite to the wedding feast?
options: Anyone found on the highways, both bad and good
Only the righteous and faithful
Only the priests and Levites
Only the children of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Anyone found on the highways, both bad and good
questions.explanation: The king instructed his servants to invite all found on the highways, both bad and good, signifying the gospel call to all peoples (Matthew 22:9-10). This aligns with the inclusive nature of the gospel seen in Luke 14:21 and Acts 10:34-35.

questions.question: What was the consequence for the man who attended the wedding feast without a wedding garment?
options: He was bound and cast into outer darkness
He was asked to leave quietly
He was given a garment and allowed to stay
He was praised for his presence
questions.correctAnswer: He was bound and cast into outer darkness
questions.explanation: The man without a wedding garment was bound hand and foot and thrown into outer darkness where there is weeping and gnashing of teeth (Matthew 22:13). This illustrates the necessity of righteousness (symbolized by the garment) for salvation, consistent with Revelation 19:8 and Isaiah 61:10.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'Many are called, but few are chosen' emphasize about God's kingdom?
options: Not all who hear the gospel respond rightly
Everyone invited automatically becomes chosen
Only a small ethnic group is chosen
God chooses people arbitrarily without regard
questions.correctAnswer: Not all who hear the gospel respond rightly
questions.explanation: The phrase highlights that while many receive the invitation, only a few respond appropriately to become part of God's kingdom (Matthew 22:14). This is consistent with Jesus' teachings on faith and election (Luke 13:23-24; Romans 8:29-30).

questions.question: Why did the Pharisees and Herodians ask Jesus about paying tribute to Caesar?
options: To entangle Him in His talk and trap Him
To seek honest advice for taxation
To express their own doubts about Caesar
To support Roman rule openly
questions.correctAnswer: To entangle Him in His talk and trap Him
questions.explanation: The Pharisees and Herodians sought to trap Jesus in His words regarding paying taxes to Caesar (Matthew 22:15-17). Jesus recognized their hypocrisy and answered wisely, demonstrating His authority and wisdom (Matthew 22:18). This episode addresses common political and religious tensions of the time.

questions.question: What was Jesus' response about giving tribute to Caesar?
options: Render unto Caesar the things which are Caesar's, and unto God the things that are God's
Refuse to pay tribute to Caesar
Pay tribute only if it benefits the poor
Avoid all taxes and worldly authorities
questions.correctAnswer: Render unto Caesar the things which are Caesar's, and unto God the things that are God's
questions.explanation: Jesus taught the proper distinction between civic responsibility and spiritual devotion, emphasizing allegiance to God above all (Matthew 22:21). This principle resonates with Romans 13:1-7 and 1 Peter 2:13-17 about respecting governing authorities while prioritizing God.

questions.question: What theological error did the Sadducees exemplify in their question about resurrection?
options: Denial of resurrection and afterlife
Belief in multiple gods
Rejection of the Mosaic law
Denial of angelic beings
questions.correctAnswer: Denial of resurrection and afterlife
questions.explanation: The Sadducees denied the resurrection, which Jesus corrected by citing God's declaration 'I am the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob' indicating He is God of the living (Matthew 22:23-32). This affirms resurrection doctrine consistent with Daniel 12:2 and 1 Corinthians 15:12-58.

questions.question: According to Jesus, what is the nature of marriage in the resurrection?
options: There is no marriage; they are like angels in heaven
They marry repeatedly in the resurrection
Marriage continues as on earth
Only one marriage per person in resurrection
questions.correctAnswer: There is no marriage; they are like angels in heaven
questions.explanation: Jesus explains that in the resurrection, people neither marry nor are given in marriage but are like angels (Matthew 22:30). This teaches about the transformed nature of resurrected life, consistent with Luke 20:34-36 and 1 Corinthians 15:42-44.

questions.question: What commandment did Jesus identify as the greatest in the law?
options: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, soul, and mind
Keep the Sabbath holy
Honor your father and mother
Do not commit adultery
questions.correctAnswer: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, soul, and mind
questions.explanation: Jesus declared the greatest commandment is to love God fully (Matthew 22:37-38), summarizing the Shema (Deuteronomy 6:5) and emphasizing the primacy of heartfelt devotion, consistent with Mark 12:29-31 and 1 John 4:20-21.

questions.question: What is the second great commandment according to Jesus, and how is it related to the first?
options: Love your neighbor as yourself; it is like the first
Keep the Sabbath; it complements the first
Pray continually; it follows the first
Give alms; it precedes the first
questions.correctAnswer: Love your neighbor as yourself; it is like the first
questions.explanation: Jesus taught that the second commandment is to love one's neighbor as oneself and that it is similar to the first (Matthew 22:39). This reveals the inseparable connection between love for God and love for others, consistent with Leviticus 19:18 and Romans 13:8-10.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the law and the prophets in relation to these two commandments?
options: All the law and the prophets hang on these two commandments
The law is abolished but the prophets remain
The prophets are more important than the law
Only the law matters, not the prophets
questions.correctAnswer: All the law and the prophets hang on these two commandments
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that the entire law and prophetic teaching depend on these two commandments of love (Matthew 22:40), confirming the centrality of love in God's moral demands, consistent with Romans 13:8-10 and Galatians 5:14.

questions.question: What messianic title do the Pharisees acknowledge Jesus as being descended from?
options: Son of David
Son of Abraham
Son of Joseph
Son of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: Son of David
questions.explanation: The Pharisees identify the Christ as the Son of David (Matthew 22:42), affirming messianic expectations grounded in the Davidic covenant (2 Samuel 7:12-16; Jeremiah 23:5-6). This title affirms Jesus' royal lineage and messianic identity.

questions.question: How does Jesus challenge the Pharisees' understanding of the Messiah in His question about David calling him 'Lord'?
options: By asking how the Messiah can be both David's son and his Lord
By denying the Messiah's Davidic descent
By claiming the Messiah is not human
By asserting the Messiah is only a prophet
questions.correctAnswer: By asking how the Messiah can be both David's son and his Lord
questions.explanation: Jesus challenges their view by quoting Psalm 110:1 where David calls the Messiah 'Lord', indicating a superior divine status, raising profound Christological implications (Matthew 22:43-45). This points to the Messiah's dual nature as Son of David and Lord, consistent with Hebrews 1:3 and Philippians 2:5-11.
